verses.verse: (Prayer for Vengeance) To the leader: Do Not Destroy. Of David. A Miktam. (Ps 82.2) Do you indeed decree what is right, you gods? Do you judge people fairly?
(Ps 94.20; Mal 3.15) No, in your hearts you devise wrongs; your hands deal out violence on earth.
(Ps 51.5; 53.3; Isa 48.8) The wicked go astray from the womb; they err from their birth, speaking lies.
(Ps 140.3; Eccl 10.11) They have venom like the venom of a serpent, like the deaf adder that stops its ear,
(Ps 81.11) so that it does not hear the voice of charmers or of the cunning enchanter.
(Job 4.10; Ps 3.7) O God, break the teeth in their mouths; tear out the fangs of the young lions, O LORD!
(Josh 7.5; Ps 64.3; 112.10) Let them vanish like water that runs away; like grass let them be trodden down (Cn: Meaning of Heb uncertain) and wither.
(Job 3.16) Let them be like the snail that dissolves into slime, like the untimely birth that never sees the sun.
(Ps 118.12; Prov 10.25) Sooner than your pots can feel the heat of thorns, whether green or ablaze, may he sweep them away!
(Ps 64.10; 68.23; 91.8) The righteous will rejoice when they see vengeance done; they will bathe their feet in the blood of the wicked.
(Ps 9.8; 18.20) People will say, “Surely there is a reward for the righteous; surely there is a God who judges (Or there are gods who judge) on earth.”
